title: Seoul: North Korea launches ballistic missile toward sea
description: South Korea says North Korea has test-launched a ballistic missile toward its eastern waters

title: Prominent Kremlin critic goes on trial on treason charges
description: A Russian court has opened a trial of a prominent Russian opposition activist on charges of treason and spreading “false information” about Russia’s military operation in Ukraine

title: 5 dead, 3 wounded in attack on Nicaraguan indigenous group
description: Local authorities in Nicaragua say at least five members of an indigenous group were killed and three others wounded in an attack by suspected settlers over the weekend

title: Ukraine short of skilled troops and munitions as losses, pessimism grow
description: Ukraine’s military has been degraded by a year of heavy casualties. Front-line units are now struggling with new, poorly trained troops and a shortage of ammunition.

title: Biden seeks tension-easing call with China’s Xi Jinping
description: With relations frosty in the wake of spy balloon controversy and with allies’ plan to outfit Australia with nuclear submarines, the U.S. president looks to dial down tensions with Beijing.

title: Kiska, last captive orca in Canada, has died at Marineland
description: A killer whale at Marineland and the last captive orca in Canada, who has swam alone in her tank for more than a decade, has died

title: Mexican president says his country safer than United States
description: Mexico’s president has claimed that his country is safer than the United States, a week after two U.S. citizens were killed and two kidnapped in the border city of Matamoros

title: Spain's ombudsman registers 445 church sex abuse complaints
description: Spain’s ombudsman says an independent commission set up a year ago to investigate historic sex abuse by the Catholic church has collected testimonies from 445 victims, as the nation tackles an issue other European countries acted on long ago

title: Imprisoned Navalny learns documentary about him wins Oscar
description: Imprisoned Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny learned from his lawyer that a film detailing his poisoning and political activism won the Oscar for best documentary feature

title: Volkswagen to build electric vehicle battery plant in Canada
description: Volkswagen says it plans to build an electric vehicle battery plant in Canada

title: Blinken to visit Ethiopia as progress under Tigray peace deal slows
description: The U.S. and Ethiopia had fallen out over allegations of atrocities committed during the two-year civil war, which ended with an agreement in November.

title: Activists: Slow response led to 30 migrant deaths off Libya
description: An activist group that supports rescue operations in the Mediterranean Sea is accusing Italy of failing to offer timely assistance to a smugglers’ boat in distress, resulting in a deadly shipwreck that left at least 30 migrants missing and presumed dead in Libya’s search-and-rescue area

title: UN: World after earthquake was slow to send aid to Syria
description: A U.N. commission says the international community and the Syrian government did not act quickly last month to help people in need in the rebel-held northwest after a deadly earthquake hit Turkey and Syria

title: Always dreamed of hiking Nepal’s highest peaks? Now you can’t do it alone.
description: Nepal’s Tourism Board said the change in policy would protect hikers after years of disappearances and accidents in the country’s difficult terrain.

title: Netanyahu allies in Israel plow ahead on legal overhaul
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s political allies are pressing ahead with their plan to overhaul the judiciary

title: At least 44 dead as Cyclone Freddy pounds Malawi, Mozambique
description: An unrelenting Cyclone Freddy that is currently battering southern Africa has killed at least 44 people in Mozambique and Malawi since it struck the continent for a second time on Saturday night, authorities in both countries have confirmed

title: UK: Tens of thousands of doctors kick off 3-day strike
description: Tens of thousands of junior doctors are on strike across England to demand better pay, kicking off three days of widespread disruption at the U.K.‘s state-funded hospitals and health clinics

title: Japan court orders retrial for 87-year death row ex-boxer
description: Tokyo’s high court has ordered a retrial for an 87-year-old former boxer who has been on death row for more than five decades

title: U.K. sports legend reinstated at BBC after clash over migration policy
description: Gary Lineker's suspension after he tweeted criticism of migration policy created a furor in Britain and calls to boycott the BBC.

title: IS claims bombing at Shiite center in northern Afghanistan
description: The Islamic State group has claimed responsibility for a bombing over the weekend at a cultural center run by the minority Shiite community in northern Afghanistan

title: A brief history of the petrol bomb during Greek protests
description: Political protests of all ideological stripes have wielded the makeshift weapon in Greece.

title: China’s Xi promises to build ‘great wall of steel’ in rivalry with West
description: Closing a meeting where he secured another term as Communist Party leader, Xi Jinping said “the Chinese nation’s great revival is on an irreversible path."

title: Iran says 22,000 arrested in protests pardoned by top leader
description: The head of Iran’s judiciary says 22,000 people arrested in the recent protests that swept the Islamic Republic have been pardoned

title: Ukraine war’s environmental toll will devastate lives for decades
description: The conflict in Ukraine is a human tragedy. It is also an environmental disaster.

title: UK boosts defense spending in response to Russia and China
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has pledged to increase U.K. military funding by 5 billion pounds ($6 billion) over the next two years in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and the challenge posed by China

title: UN chief: 'Cold, hard facts' should guide climate policy
description: The head of the United Nations has called for scientists to serve up “cold, hard facts” to push governments into making policies that curb climate change before a key global warming threshold is passed

title: Iran-Saudi Arabia deal casts China in unfamiliar global role
description: An agreement between Iran and Saudi Arabia to re-establish diplomatic relations has cast China in a leading role in Middle Eastern politics — a part previously reserved for longtime global heavyweights like the U.S. and Russia

title: As Francis marks a decade as pope, what does it mean to be 86?
description: For most of us, it’s an age beyond the realm of what we’ll ever experience.

title: Saudi Arabia launches new airline, entering crowded field
description: Riyadh Air hopes to fly to 100 destinations by 2030, as Saudi Arabia seeks to lessen its dependence on oil revenue.

title: Japan’s Kenzaburo Oe, awarded Nobel for poetic fiction, dies
description: Nobel literature laureate Kenzaburo Oe, whose darkly poetic novels were built from his childhood memories during Japan’s postwar occupation and from being the parent of a disabled son, has died

title: India enthuses over Oscars for 'Naatu Naatu,' elephant doc
description: India celebrated its two historic Academy Awards with enthusiasm befitting the high-energy best original song “Naatu Naatu.”

title: 10 iconic moments in Pope Francis' first 10 years as pontiff
description: Pope Francis is marking the 10th anniversary of his election as pope on Monday

title: Japan’s Kenzaburo Oe, awarded Nobel for poetic fiction, dies
description: A Japanese publisher Kodansha Ltd

title: Michelle Yeoh's mom tearful, proud of 'little princess'
description: Michelle Yeoh’s mother cried for joy for her “little princess” when the Malaysian became the first Asian to win the best actress Oscar

title: Fire damages part of Cambodian king's residence near temple
description: Fire has damaged part of the provincial residence of Cambodia’s King Norodom Sihamoni while he was abroad

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia suffering heavy losses in Bakhmut, Zelensky says
description: Russia’s military leadership could be letting the Wagner mercenary group bear the brunt of casualties in Bakhmut, analysts say.
